conclusion: The gas undergoes different processes as shown in the graphs.
The V-T graph indicates an isobaric (constant pressure) process from 400 K to 600 K.
The pressure remains constant while the volume increases with temperature.
We need to find the pressure at 400 K, which is the same pressure at 600 K.
The p-T graph shows that at 400 K, the pressure is 1.0 × 10⁵ Pa.
Since the V-T graph indicates an isobaric process from 400 K to 600 K, the pressure remains constant at 1.0 × 10⁵ Pa throughout this temperature range.
The pressure of the gas when the temperature is 600 K is the same as the pressure at 400 K, which is 1.0 × 10⁵ Pa.
